raw_text:
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
FW: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation
17 messages
Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 8:11 AM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
Please see below from Barbie’s office.
Traci Sinclair
Paralegal to Dianne James Davis
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172 (Phone)
(256) 392-3578 (Fax)
paralegal@diannedavislaw.com
From: Aria Barjis <aria@agricolalaw.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 30, 2025 4:10 PM
To: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Cc: Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>; Barbara Agricola <barbara@agricolalaw.com>;
Maildrop Brittany Gilliland <1f625a84d+matter1681760195@maildrop.clio.com>; Su Jin Carpenter
<suj@agricolalaw.com>
Subject: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation
Dianne--
As you are aware, on June 18, 2025, the judge specifically ordered Blaine to follow with the final order of divorce, which the parties
had been doing, albeit amended slightly for summer visitation, since summer started. The June 18th order specifically references
the visitation of the final order, meaning the divorce order, and therefore, your interpretation of it being any other orders is
incorrect. The judge issued another order on July 24, 2025, in reference to Addie Kate, stating for Blaine not to let Addie Kate
choose if she wants to exercise visitation with her mom.
Blaine is stating that he refuses to comply, please see the text messages attached. Please remind him of what the judge has
ordered.
Brittany will be there on the 7th of August to exchange both children for her visitation. She would also like to request that she be
able to see the kids off for their first day of school, if possible. Please let me know. Thank you.
Ariabel Barjis
Legal Assistant
Agricola Law
7.24.25 Order on Final Order.pdf, 6.19.25 Order on CS and Visitation.pdf, IMG_5039.pdf
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 9:30 AM
To: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>, Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>, Darlene Meadows
<billing@diannedavislaw.com>
Do we need to ask the judge for clarification? The order stating the final order was signed by the judge on 6.19 - The
latest order signed by the judge on 7.24 states follow orders.
We have a temporary order in place until the final hearing. The purpose of this temporary order was to do away with
forcing Visits with AK, moved the dinners to Sunday, & visitation for Bennett Friday to Monday.
They can't pick & choose out of which order they want to go with.
Barbi & Brittany agreed to this in court which allowed us to settle on that temporary order until final hearing.
Where do we go from here?
[Quoted text hidden]
Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 9:54 AM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
I have printed this email for Dianne, along with the email from Barbie’s assistant, and your email from yesterday with the attachments. I know
this is terribly upsetting, Blaine and I understand. Just trust what Dianne says after she reviews everything.
[Quoted text hidden]
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 9:58 AM
To: Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>
I'm not upset at you all at all! I'm upset that we agreed to this temporary order & now Brittany/Barbi always try to find
loopholes etc... it's BS
[Quoted text hidden]
Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 10:03 AM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
Of course! We all understand that our clients are not angry with us but with the situation, etc. Also, you must be so frustrated. Brittany’s
words DO NOT match her actions with AK. She suddenly is pushing for visitation but has nothing to do with AK! Dianne should be here
soon.
[Quoted text hidden]
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 11:01 AM
To: Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>
Yea, very frustrated but not at yall! Love you all to death! I honestly don't think I would be in this position had I started
with yall! :)
It's just draining financially & mentally.... Brittany doesn't truly want AK to visit... She uses AK as leverage in all
areas... Getting me in trouble, trying to get more time with Bennett... etc...
Brittany doesn't even have a place for AK to sleep. They have a 2 bedroom house with Bennett, the baby, & Bradley's
2 girls.. I know it's not the point because if Brittany had a good relationship with AK it wouldn't matter but still she
needs to have AK a space to sleep in my opinion.
[Quoted text hidden]
Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 11:27 AM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
I believe Dianne is going to call you today.
[Quoted text hidden]
Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 3:16 PM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
Please see Dianne’s email to Aria, below.
Traci Sinclair
Paralegal to Dianne James Davis
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172 (Phone)
(256) 392-3578 (Fax)
paralegal@diannedavislaw.com
From: Dianne Davis
Sent: Thursday, July 31, 2025 3:16 PM
To: 'Aria Barjis' <aria@agricolalaw.com>
Subject: RE: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation
Below is Dianne’s response to your email of 7.30.25.
The order of July 24, 2025 is where the judge referenced the “orders”. This is a .01 case and these are
orders from that case pertaining to Addie Kate and Bennett. The order regarding Bennett, the days were changed
because of school and Brittany moving, without notice, over two hours away round trip.
I was told that at the last family dinner when Blaine met Brittany in Prattville because she could not even make
it here, Brittany would not even sit at the same table with them. Addie Kate asked her mom to sit with them but she
refused. I find that strange for a mother who is trying to reconnect with her daughter.
We are of the opinion that the Court is referring to all the orders in the .01 case. Be assured that Blaine has
done everything to get Addie Kate to visit with her mom.
[Quoted text hidden]
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Thu, Jul 31 at 3:19 PM
To: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Thank you!
[Quoted text hidden]
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Fri, Aug 1 at 12:11 PM

<paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>
Good Morning!
Did they respond or have you heard anything?
Brittany hasn't responded about getting Bennett today.
Thanks,
Blaine
[Quoted text hidden]

Darlene

Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Fri, Aug 1 at 12:59 PM
To: Darlene Meadows <billing@diannedavislaw.com>
Cc: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>, Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>
Brittany said her attorney confirmed with her that her visitation starts next week & they are following the final decree
which is Thursday-Monday.
If she doesn’t pick Bennett up & utilize her visitation this weekend then she’s not getting my time next week just
because they are totally ignoring the temporary order for the .01 case.
[Quoted text hidden]
Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com> Fri, Aug 1 at 1:06 PM
To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
Always something with her..
[Quoted text hidden]
Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Fri, Aug 1 at 1:16 PM
To: Traci Sinclair <paralegal@diannedavislaw.com>
yea... keeps my nerves on edge...
We should file contempt on Brittany if she doesn't pick up for visitation today. If we don't, they will file contempt on
me next Thursday when they claim her visitation starts.
Also, Brittany refuses to answer about Sunday Dinners.. So I'm in limbo... If they are ignoring the temp order that
changed the dinners to Sunday & going off the final decree there are no Dinners listed in our Decree.
I asked Brittany Wednesday & Today to let me know what time Sunday for Dinner - But she hasn't responded
[Quoted text hidden]

To: Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com>
She ignores orders yet insists that certain parts of other orders be followed. Please send those texts.

I even offered Breakfast last Saturday.
